website_summaries.verdict: This olive pitter comes at a bargain price point and reliably removes pits.
pros: Easy to wash because this model is dishwasher safe
Easy to use via its clamping motion that does a solid job of reliably removing pits
Easy to grip and isn’t slippery in hand while in use
cons: Not the best option for smaller olives

customer_reviews.title: Best cherry pitter I've used
customer_reviews.text: I've owned two other cherry pitters previously, one a cheapo from China and the other one from Williams-Sonoma; this one works much better than either of those. I love making lots of desserts with cherries when they are in season, and this one works very well and can be cleaned in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle M. Maze

customer_reviews.title: The spring broke on day 2
customer_reviews.text: I pick 20+ pounds of cherries every year and usually use a metal straw to pit them. This year I splurged and purchased this cherry pitter, which had been recommended to me. The pitter is easy to use and is comfortable in my hand. The pitter’s “spring” is a thin strip of metal that is strung inside the handle. The metal strip broke at the hinge on the second day I used the pitter, so the pitter no longer springs back. Looks like I’m back to the straw.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Hiller

customer_reviews.title: Fancy Easy Cherry Pitter
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure I need this now, but it looked so functional, that I'm sure I will at some time!!! Who can resist that it has a drop-off and pick-up ledge?! And a disposal chute? I can't wait for fruit season!
customer_reviews.author: MBel

customer_reviews.title: Pretty darn good
customer_reviews.text: Best one I found so far. It does splatter somewhat but not sure any other one is less messy. Most pits come out cleanly but you need to watch carefully
customer_reviews.author: P. Daugharty

customer_reviews.title: Life just got easier!
customer_reviews.text: This works so nice! I have been making a mess during cherry season before I bought this as I love making cherry health shakes. With this product its like I am done pitting a whole bag of cherries in 10 minutes, if that! Before, yeah, took me a long time. Live and learn. So happy I bought this product!
customer_reviews.author: Seraphimrose

customer_reviews.title: Oh I love this. Kiddo loves to get the pits out ...
customer_reviews.text: Oh I love this. Kiddo loves to get the pits out of cherries with this tool. Easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Ads

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Works as promised. Would recommend wearing clothes that you don't mind getting cherry juice on, as when you pit one, there's sometime juice squirting out. Good quality construction, no issues with the product.
customer_reviews.author: DHLB

customer_reviews.title: You Don't Need It Until You Need It.
customer_reviews.text: Local supermarket had a good deal on cherries, so I bought one of these. My wife says it works great and is a big time saver. I say, the Cherry Tart was great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to pit olives. Works great, Much easier than hand slicing olive pits with a knife. Would be better if could process multiple olives at once, but low pit through ratio.
customer_reviews.author: GB Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but pin holding the two parts together - falls out during use
customer_reviews.text: works great, I used it to pit a pile of olives... but the pin in the handle -holding both parts together keeps falling out. You have to be mindful of the pin while using it...or it will get lost!
customer_reviews.author: Diane of the Desert

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This product works well for pitting cherries. I was staring at 20lbs of cherries to ready for the freezer. This product made the chore of pitting them very easy. It did take 8 hours but now the cherries are packaged and ready for eating all winter long.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi Gillespie

customer_reviews.title: Does job beautifully
customer_reviews.text: Gift for my daughter who loved it. She goes cherry picking every spring and she says this works great. I think I will get me one next year.
customer_reviews.author: LauraTop Contributor: Knitting

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly despite my doubts.
customer_reviews.text: I never used a pitter before, but I've been buying some excellent olives from the farmers market and they don't come pitted, so . . . This thing works like a charm. Doesn't take much time, hasn't missed a pit yet, and seems to go through the dishwasher just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Main

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: does what it does no problems seems sturdy has lasted awhile now worth the cost, would buy again
customer_reviews.author: R. J. Gravelle

customer_reviews.title: Effective but not exactly easy or mess-free
customer_reviews.text: Not that easy to use - it definitely takes force, and I get shot with cherry juice each time. But, it does what it needs to do!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: LOVE it!!! I bought cherries and pitted them in no time with this. Well worth The small investment.
customer_reviews.author: Bernadette M Brazeal

customer_reviews.title: A Must for the Cherry Lover.
customer_reviews.text: As a WA girl not sure how we cherry lovers lived without this device! I even used it on frozen and defrosted gushy cherries and it worked like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: RaeRae Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Easy to press.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy material. Used it for cherries and had not problem with the pitting. As described.
customer_reviews.author: Andika

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does not work on smaller size olives. The whole olive pop thru or gets stuck inside.
customer_reviews.author: Ars Aris

customer_reviews.title: good quality, good price
customer_reviews.text: Feels very nice in the hand, not slippery. Dishwasher safe. Making something like a cherry cobbler has turned into a pleasant experience rather than tedious and annoying :)). Really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Irina D.

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: Works decently but the lever that is supposed to keep it closed has never worked. DOA. Contemplating send me it back. But it works in general.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: It handles the pits
customer_reviews.text: I have only pitted cherries with this but it seems to work well. I've had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: M. Morning

customer_reviews.title: Clever product!
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly easy to use and does a great job! Very fast with perfect results.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Leaves a lot of pits
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't thrilled with this at all. If pits came out, cherries were stuck in the pitter. Cherries came out mashed.
customer_reviews.author: Typer

customer_reviews.title: Broke After Six Olives
customer_reviews.text: This device may work on cherries and very ripe olives, but they are terrible for green olives. This thing broke on the sixth olive.
customer_reviews.author: John A.

customer_reviews.title: My Wife and I love this Cherry Pitter
customer_reviews.text: My Wife and I love this Cherry Pitter! Saves a lot of time and we no longer have to sort out the pit from the cherry in our mouth :)
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: well built
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to operate, seems to be well built should last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Thomason

customer_reviews.title: ... this as a gift for my mom and she'sin love with it
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my mom and she'sin love with it. I want to order three more pitters for my grandmom and aunts .
customer_reviews.author: amaal

customer_reviews.title: The concept is great but it's pretty much hit or miss
customer_reviews.text: The idea is great but often the pitter would drive through the cherry and leave the pit behind. I also think it's a bit messy.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Forbes-Skubic

customer_reviews.title: Simple but effective
customer_reviews.text: This is a very clean and easy way to pit cherries. You don't have to push very hard, and the place the cherry sits prevents it from getting smashed. Best pitter I have yet found!
customer_reviews.author: anonymous book worm

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my brother and he absolutly loved it. He thought it was so great he even brought it over with him for the holidays with some cherry's. Would recommend pitting over a bowl or paper town though as the pit some juice can splash out the bottom if you are an overzelous user. Only reason I gave it 4 stars opposed to 5 is was b/c it was a present and I didn't actaully get to use to often and write any thing more indepth about it.
customer_reviews.author: LuvShping

customer_reviews.title: quick and easy
customer_reviews.text: Went through 3 lbs of cherries in no time. good tool
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: I have others I like better, but it is functional
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I have others I like better, but it is functional. I have another brand that doesn't have the removable cup and it works a little smoother. I have a small cafe' in Peru, South America and I personally pit a kilo of our local olives every day, so I really appreciate as easy tool that works. This one is OK for the occasional user, but not for a heavy user like myself.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy Leue

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It did not work well on olives; the uncured olives are too hard for this pitter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gasket broke first time using it.
customer_reviews.text: The rubber gasket tore the first time I used this olive pitter. I contacted Cuisipro asking what I could do about it; they haven't responded yet.
customer_reviews.author: L. Weiland

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Good product. It's easy to use and is able to lock for better storage. It gets the job done-not perfect-it did spray some juice and miss a pit here and there- but otherwise it is a big timesaver if you have kids thy love cherries!! I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Clumsy
customer_reviews.text: This product is sort of clumsy. I like the idea of it, but if you are pitting smaller items it doesn't work all that well.
customer_reviews.author: mseiler

customer_reviews.title: Cuisipro Cherry/ Olive Pitter
customer_reviews.text: Pitter worked fantastic. I pitted over 3 gallons of cherries quickly. I recommend this pitter for anyone wanting to home can their own cherries.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Great for Olives!
customer_reviews.text: I was in the market for an olive pitter and discovered cherry pitters are the way to go. Easy enough. But then I started reading the reviews - not just for this one, but all pitters - and saw some pretty crazy comments about their quality or ease of use. I've had great luck with Cuisipro products in the past, so I took a chance on this one and am happy to say this is no exception! I got the pitter and found that it was so easy to use, from dropping the pit into the middle to pressing the lever/grip to extracting the olive. Plus, it was easy to clean. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Jenty56

customer_reviews.title: Review of item
customer_reviews.text: No mess and the olive just pops out minus the pit. I tried other pit removers and had a mess. I almost gave up but this looked good and I figured I would try it. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Carol McGuire

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Arrived just as described. Works great! Good quality. Recommend to all. Love the quick shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Dan D Hardy Jr

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work
customer_reviews.text: Shouldn't have to break a wrist to have this thing work.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Universal Design: Good for slippery, clumsy, or aging hands
customer_reviews.text: This pitter seems to have been engineered with Universal Design principles in mind. Because it uses a clasping motion rather than a scissors-like motion, and because the front scoop can also be used as a handle for the off hand, this pitter is easier to use by those whose hands don't fully cooperate. Good for arthritis sufferers as well as for busy moms with freshly washed and slippery hands. Cleans up easily and stores compactly.
customer_reviews.author: JN

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Would be perfect if the splash guard actually did anything. But to be fair, the pitter can't control where the fruit sprays. But otherwise, worth the money to be able to feed my toddler cherries without staining my hands red at a cutting board for half an hour.
customer_reviews.author: SWegener

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT use on Olives!!!
customer_reviews.text: Item is clearly durable enough to pit Cherries but it goes to hell quickly when used on Olives. It does not do a clean job on the Olives it does pit and the soft center section tears after pitting just a few dozzen Olives. I have cured Olives for a long time and know what I'm doing. I WAS NOT abusing this tool in any way. I was able to salvage the tool, repair it and it will be used solely as a Cherry Pitting Tool from this day forward and I am sure that it will do a fine job.
customer_reviews.author: janet de leon

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: Handy product. Works as described. I like the locked close feature for storing.
customer_reviews.author: A reviewer

customer_reviews.title: na
customer_reviews.text: I plan to use it for pitting my home made olives.
customer_reviews.author: christine perfetto

customer_reviews.title: Great little gadget
customer_reviews.text: I used this to pit cherries. It works as well I hoped it would.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: I AM SO GLAD I PURCHASED THIS PITTER
customer_reviews.text: I AM SO GLAD I PURCHASED THIS PITTER.IT IS A JOY TO PIT THIS FRUIT SO QUICKLY,I THANKS AMAZON.AND CUISPRO.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I never even realized this type of product existed until a couple of months ago when a friend brought one to a party! I immediately ordered this one from Amazon and put it to the test. This product is great. It is very easy to use and it holds the cherry nicely for you so you don't have a mess. I'd easily recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Wyatt Family

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted. There IS some splatter when you pit cherries ... wear dark clothes or an apron. Seems very durable and I have a high success rate ... maybe 1/5 of pits don't eject properly.
customer_reviews.author: GH

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: Wish I would have discovered this product years ago! Excellent! I only use it for cherries so can not say how it works on olives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy. Semi-clean job.
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty self-explanatory. Put the cherry in, press. Easy to use but it does splash. I had to use this over the sink so I wouldn't get cherry bits of splats on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: It's cherry season, and I can't wait to make ...
customer_reviews.text: It's cherry season, and I can't wait to make my CLAFOUTIS. Using the pitter makes the job so much easier
customer_reviews.author: David Congram

customer_reviews.title: A very good cherry pitter.
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. I pitted 7 lbs of cherries in pretty short order. I highly recommend this cherry pitter.
customer_reviews.author: J. Runnels

customer_reviews.title: Glad I made the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Performs exactly as advertised, sturdy construction, works on all except the very small and only problem is that you're digging out the fruit
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Olive pitter use
customer_reviews.text: Holds the Olive well, larger cured green olives. Did not mangle the olive.
customer_reviews.author: Deedee

customer_reviews.title: works really well
customer_reviews.text: I bought on a whim, but the product does exactly what it describes. Pits the cherry perfectly almost every time. If you like Cherries you definitely need one of these to eat them quickly.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: We now own two of these. Bought the second one for cherry season this year because the first one worked so well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: This cherry pitter is great! I have used it with both cherries and olives. It worked especially well on the sour cherries, which are very delicate.
customer_reviews.author: CarMann

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I got this because of the tedious work involved with pitting cherries for my cherry pies. It is so helpful and now my fingers are not dyed red for days after :)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: What a pleasure eating cherries now! No more chewing around the pit and risking a filling cracking. Works great with olives as well. I just wish I'd bought a pitter sooner.
customer_reviews.author: NikosF

customer_reviews.title: Messy
customer_reviews.text: Good mechanics, but very sloppy, best to use outside to make cherry lemonade
customer_reviews.author: Wendyswills

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this pitter for olives
customer_reviews.text: After pitting about a dozen olives the silicon insert that allows different sizes to be pitted by the machine tore. Afterwards all the olives I pitted had the lower portion torn off and I had to clear the logged olive parts every two to three olives and put the torn portion back in place. I now have to buy a new pitter for next season and will not buy this one again. After it tore the smaller olives would lodge in the pitter and would have to be manually removed. Took several hours to finish pitting the 3 gallons of olives instead it should have take slightly over and hour due to the defective pitter.
customer_reviews.author: Leland I Pratt, Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: I've never owned a Pitter before but a friend loaned me hers recently and I decided I needed my own I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Pam and Richard

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate
customer_reviews.text: Where has this been all my life? After two clamoring kids I can pit cherries fast enough to feed them. Sometimes the pits get stuck and there is a little splashing of juice, but so worth it all for pitted cherries in a snap.
customer_reviews.author: valuhunter

customer_reviews.title: A good pitter!!
customer_reviews.text: This pitter works just fine for my purposes. Have not had any problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sara McCoy

customer_reviews.title: High quality, works great.
customer_reviews.text: I love this gizmo. It's high quality construction, comfortable, easy to use, great to give as gifts, too.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Magliane

customer_reviews.title: Glad she has it
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my mom. She said it works great. She really liked it. She wishes she would have had it a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Strauss

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gift!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a gift for a friend because I like mine so much. It works quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Rose

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great product. why did I wait so long to buy this?
customer_reviews.author: Jason Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t know these existed...I absolutely love this. Works sooooo easy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Connie F.

product_meta.title: CUISIPRO Cherry Pitter, 1 EA
product_meta.description: Today's home chef demands tools that deliver consistent, superior performance with every use. Cuisipro tools have been created to perform specific tasks with precision and ease while always providing the finest results. Cuisipro's new Cheery and Olive pitter is unique because of its one-of-A -kind scoop that makes the process of pitting cherries easier. the scoop feature simplifies the process and leaves your other hand free for other tasks. The scoop feature, plus the long splash guard tube will help protect the user and work area from splattering juice. The generous silicone cup has flexible fins, without them, they will not hold both cherries and olives well. Compact storage, the mechanism can lock and stay closed when not in use. Dishwasher safe- top rack only.
feature_bullets: Uniquely designed scoop makes scooping up cherries and pitting an easy, one hand operation
Extra long splash guard protects work area from splattering juice. Generously sized holder accommodates large cherries as well as olives
Silicone cup with flexible fins holds both cherries and olives in place
Locking mechanism keeps pitter closed for compact storage
Easy to clean. Dishwasher safe-top rack.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars261 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
